benchmark_details.name: MalEval
benchmark_details.overview: MalEval is a comprehensive evaluation framework for fine-grained Android malware auditing, designed to assess how effectively LLMs can support behavior auditing under real-world constraints.
benchmark_details.data_type: malware and benign samples with behavior reports

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate LLMs in fine-grained Android malware auditing.

data.source: Curated dataset of malware samples and benign apps with manually verified reports.
data.annotation: Manual verification of behavior reports and sensitive API lists.

methods: Systematic evaluation using ground truth reports
Expert-guided tasks for real-world audit scenarios
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance in detecting malicious behaviors and generating credible reports.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in accurately identifying and synthesizing malware behavior.
methodology.baseline_results: Evaluation of seven widely used LLMs including Claude-3.7-sonnet, which achieved 50.67% WRS.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation through expert analysis of generated reports.
